>
> Wow!  Lots of quick responses.  Some quick replies:
>
>  Julien - I have indeed seen the contest and I've thought of
>  entering.  The big issues is that you get a graphic file of the
>  screen, so I would need to extract details from the graphic, or let
>  NEAT find features.  While that would be very cool if it worked, I
>  would be amazed if it could work from first principles but would
>  rather require a hearty set of primitives.  They mention the
>  possible availability of an API to extract features, but I have yet
>  to see it come to life.
>

I saw a basic feature extraction algorithm up and running in Simons
office the other day - I think he will post it online as soon as he
has sorted out a bug or two.

But being able to extract information from the raw image would of
course be way cooler - I think NEAT has some potential there, as it
starts out with minimal connectivity, and can thus potentially handle
such a massive input array. (Which a standard fixed-topology net would
certainly not do...)

Also, Wesley, have you tried mailing Simon about your problems with
getting the code running? I'm sure he would like to know.

--
